definition: sb who sacrifices himself/sacrificial victim/sb who is expendable

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Motorcyclists and bicyclists are often the victims in such cases.
sentences.chinese: 機車與腳踏車騎士常常是這種狀況的犧牲者。

sentences.english: Because it’s all about Patty, see, she’s always got to be the victim.
sentences.chinese: 又是爲了帕蒂，聽明白了吧，她總是要做那個犧牲者。

sentences.english: L12) He was a victim of racial discrimination .
sentences.chinese: 他是種族歧視的犧牲者。

sentences.english: This memorial commemorates those who died in the war.
sentences.chinese: 這座紀念碑是紀念戰爭中犧牲者的。

sentences.english: They buried the victims where they fell.
sentences.chinese: 他們把這些犧牲者埋葬在他們陣亡的地方。

sentences.english: Power takes as ingratitude the writhings of its victims .
sentences.chinese: 勢力以爲犧牲者的痛苦是忘恩負義。

sentences.english: Studies suggest that satisficers tend to be happier than maximizers.
sentences.chinese: 研究表明犧牲者傾向於比最大化者更快樂。

sentences.english: The chief leaders usually acted on their own and become prey to feuds and jealousy.
sentences.chinese: 首要領導獨自行動了和通常成爲犧牲者對仇隙和嫉妒。

sentences.english: It sees the dead as heroic martyrs.
sentences.chinese: 它把犧牲者視作英雄般的殉道士。

sentences.english: Their action and attitude had greatly honored the victims.
sentences.chinese: 他們的行動和態度給了犧牲者莫大的榮譽。

sentences.english: That he was an innocent victim was harder to say.
sentences.chinese: 很難說他是一個無辜的犧牲者。

sentences.english: Mary of Magdala was the victim of a fearful evil.
sentences.chinese: 抹大拉的馬利亞是可怕罪惡的犧牲者。

sentences.english: Soon the royal cook came to kill the willing victim on the block.
sentences.chinese: 很快，御廚來宰殺砧板上心甘情願的犧牲者了。

sentences.english: Some experts say they are modern-day victims of an antiquated system.
sentences.chinese: 一些專家說他們是一個古舊制度的現代犧牲者。

sentences.english: power takes as ingratitude the writhings of its victims.
sentences.chinese: 勢力認爲犧牲者的疾苦是利令智昏。

sentences.english: We are poor victims of situations, circumstances and genetics.
sentences.chinese: 我們是可憐的環境和基因的犧牲者。

definition: to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
Taroko, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan
